006
007package renderer.models_TP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011
012import java.util.Scanner;
013import java.io.File;
014import java.io.FileInputStream;
015import java.io.IOException;
016import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
017import java.util.regex.*;
018import java.util.ArrayList;
019
020/**
021<p>
022   A simple demonstration of loading and drawing a basic OBJ file.
023<p>
024   A basic OBJ file is a text file that contains three kinds of lines:
025   lines that begin with the character {@code 'v'}, lines that begin
026   with the character {@code 'f'}, and lines that begin with the
027   character {@code '#'}.
028<p>
029   A line in an OBJ file that begins with {@code '#'} is a comment line
030   and can be ignored.
031<p>
032   A line in an OBJ file that begins with {@code 'v'} is a line that
033   describes a vertex in 3-dimensional space. The {@code 'v'} will always
034   be followed on the line by three doubles, the {@code x}, {@code y},
035   and {@code z} coordinates of the vertex.
036<p>
037   A line in an OBJ file that begins with {@code 'f'} is a line that
038   describes a "face". The {@code 'f'} will be followed on the line by
039   a sequence of positive integers. The integers are the indices of the
040   vertices that make up the face. The "index" of a vertex is the order
041   in which the vertex was listed in the OBJ file. So a line like this
042<pre>{@code
043      f  2  4  1
044}</pre>
045   would represent a triangle made up of the 2nd vertex read from the file,
046   the 4th vertex read from the file, and the 1st vertex read from the file.
047   And a line like this
048<pre>{@code
049      f  2  4  3  5
050}</pre>
051   would represent a quadrilateral made up of the 2nd vertex read from the file,
052   the 4th vertex read from the file, the 3rd vertex read from the file, and
053   the 5th vertex read from the file.
054<p>
055   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wavefront_.obj_file" target="_top">
056                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wavefront_.obj_file</a>
057*/
058public class ObjSimpleModel extends Model
059{
060   /**
061      Create a wireframe model from the contents of an OBJ file.
062
063      @param objFile  {@link File} object for the OBJ data file
064   */
065   public ObjSimpleModel(final File objFile)
066   {
067      super(objFile.getPath());
068
069      // Open the OBJ file.
070      FileInputStream fis = null;
071      try
072      {
073         fis = new FileInputStream( objFile );
074      }
075      catch (FileNotFoundException e)
076      {
077         e.printStackTrace(System.err);
078         System.err.printf("ERROR! Could not find OBJ file: %s\n", objFile);
079         System.exit(-1);
080      }
081
082      // Get the geometry from the OBJ file.
083      try
084      {
085         // Pattern for parsing lines that start with "f".
086         final Pattern p = Pattern.compile("^(\\d*)[/]?(\\d*)[/]?(\\d*)");
087
088         final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(fis);
089         while ( scanner.hasNext() )
090         {
091            final String token = scanner.next();
092            if ( token.startsWith("#")
093              || token.startsWith("vt")
094              || token.startsWith("vn")
095              || token.startsWith("s")
096              || token.startsWith("g")
097              || token.startsWith("o")
098              || token.startsWith("usemtl")
099              || token.startsWith("mtllib") )
100            {
101               scanner.nextLine(); // skip over these lines
102            }
103            else if ( token.startsWith("v") )
104            {
105               final double x = scanner.nextDouble();
106               final double y = scanner.nextDouble();
107               final double z = scanner.nextDouble();
108               final Vertex v = new Vertex(x, y, z);
109               this.addVertex( v );
110            }// parse vertex
111            else if ( token.startsWith("f") )
112            {
113               // Tokenize the rest of the line.
114               final String restOfLine = scanner.nextLine();
115               final Scanner scanner2 = new Scanner( restOfLine );
116               // Parse vertex indices and add them to a TriangleFan primitive.
117               final Primitive triFan = new TriangleFan();
118               while (scanner2.hasNext())
119               {
120                  // Parse a "v/vt/vn" group.
121                  final String faceGroup = scanner2.next();
122                  final Matcher m = p.matcher( faceGroup );
123                  if ( m.find() )
124                  {
125                     final int vertexIndex = Integer.parseInt( m.group(1) );
126                     final String vt = m.group(2);  // don't need
127                     final String vn = m.group(3);  // don't need
128                     triFan.addIndex( vertexIndex - 1 );
129                  }
130                  else
131                     System.err.println("Error: bad face: " + faceGroup);
132               }
133               // Add the TriangleFan to the model.
134               this.addPrimitive( triFan );
135            }// parse face
136         }// parse one line
137         fis.close();
138      }
139      catch (Exception e)
140      {
141         e.printStackTrace(System.err);
142         System.err.printf("ERROR! Could not read OBJ file: %s\n", objFile);
143         System.exit(-1);
144      }
145   }
146}//ObjSimpleModel
